page.title: 12HM Prison Barlinnie
page.content: Built in 1882,it serves 52 courts in Strathclyde and part Central Region. Staff of 378 care for 893 convicted men plus 407 untried,all over 21,in 987 cells.Doctors and Chaplains visit regularly.Prisoners work in units such as joinery,textile,upholstery as well as in the kitchen,laundry and grounds. The education unit,with computers,aids learning.The "Special Unit" was opened in 1973.An intensive care unit,it was designed for prisoners who had not in- tegrated into the prison system.Some are returned to the system and then to society.Others have recommitted them- selves.Prisoners are allowed one third remission of sentence for behaving.The period of remission can be lessened if behaviour warrants this.Untried men are allowed visitors each weekday. Convicted men are allowed visitors on two evenings each month.
